metadata.dc:author: Porcel, J M
metadata.dc:description: In this narrative review we describe the main aetiologies, clinical characteristics and treatment for patients with benign pleural effusion that characteristically persists over time: chylothorax and cholesterol effusions, nonexpansible lung, rheumatoid pleural effusion, tuberculous empyema, benign asbestos pleural effusion and yellow nail syndrome.
metadata.dc:subject: Benign asbestos pleural effusion
Catéter pleural tunelizado

metadata.dc:title: Derrames pleurales benignos persistentes.
Persistent benign pleural effusion.
